problem:
问题10. 设 $a, b, c \in \mathbf{R}^{+}$, 且 $a b c=1$, 求证:
$$
\frac{1}{1+2 a}+\frac{1}{1+2 b}+\frac{1}{1+2 c} \geqslant 1 \text {. }
$$
solution: 令 $a=\frac{x}{y}, b=\frac{y}{z}, c=\frac{z}{x}$, 则原不等式等价于 $\frac{y}{2 x+y}+\frac{z}{2 y+z}+ \frac{x}{2 z+x} \geqslant 1$. 由柯西不等式, 得 $[x(x+2 z)+y(y+2 x)+z(z+ 2 y)]\left(\frac{x}{x+2 z}+\frac{y}{y+2 x}+\frac{z}{z+2 y}\right) \geqslant(x+y+z)^2$, 即 $(x+y+ z)^2\left(\frac{x}{x+2 z}+\frac{y}{y+2 x}+\frac{z}{z+2 y}\right) \geqslant(x+y+z)^2$.
